content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

```
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(strip(lowercase(col)), r"\s+", "_")
end
```
This function takes a string `col` as input and returns the cleaned column name with the following operations:

1. Lowercasing the input string using `lowercase`.
2. Stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces from the lowercased string using `strip`.
3. Replacing any spaces and hyphens in the stripped string with an underscore using `replace` with a regular expression pattern of `\s+`, which matches one or more whitespace characters (including spaces, tabs, and line breaks). The replacement string is `_`, which replaces each match with an underscore.

For example, if you call the function with the input "My Column", it will return the cleaned column name "my_column".
